activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shantrice P Craig

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:55 AM Defendant Shantrice P Craig in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Defendant hired an atty named Bob. This atty did not appear today.  Defendant says she did not have the money to pay the atty all of the money.  Defendant is going to fill out a petition for a county atty.  Court goes off the record to fill this out.  
Back on the record at 10:10am.  Defendant provides the court with a petition for court appointed atty.  Defendant is now unemployed.  BTC: Defendant to do back to SPD and re-apply.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim S.J (person, property, residence or family). No contact with Olympic Liquor.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shantrice P Craig appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Shantrice P Craig. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
